Well, since our order never came, it was almost 40 minutes after we had ordered, we had 3 bowls of chips and salsa, watching a game I didn't enjoy nor understand (I don't speak Spanish) and we had to sit there and watch Soccer on (I think) Univision, (which I didn't understand since 1/2 price appetizers where for the Cards game), the little girl at the table next to me had let out her 8th high-pitched wail, we were done and left.   I left a tip for the water, chips and salsa, but I was NOT going to pay for yucky ceviche.  

It's not a place I would ever even give another chance too.  The food being brought to other tables didn't even look good, not impressed.  Go at your own risk, don't expect too much though.  

Again, this was my experience and it may or may not have been unique.  I would not go here again, and my brother owes me some gas money with a sprinkle for chips and salsa!
Delicious! It turns into a night club on the other side where the bar is. The food was perfect and came out really fast! We will definitely be back!

I have no idea where to start.... everything from the shrimp covered bacon, chips & salsa, baja burger, nachos and double wrapped carne asada burrito were on point.  I normally don't like Mexican food but this place was delicious and reasonably priced. Definitely a go see.

We took some friends of ours from England to Baja Joe's for a taste of Mexican food.  We were so disappointed.  The chips were not warm or crispy and the salsa was thin, soupy and tasteless.   Not a good start.  My husband and I shared Fajitas.  The chicken was completely dry, the steak was OK, and the shrimp was tasteless (although we had more shrimp than I expected).  We asked for a mixture of corn and flour tortillas.  The corn tortillas fell apart in my hands after two bites.  The flour tortilla was translucent and didn't taste good.  Oh well.  Our friends Tostada had a burned shell on the bottom.  They seemed to like their food, but we don't feel they really had a chance at really excellent Mexican food.  
I will say our server was attentive, pleasant and helpful.

3 1/2 stars, down from 4 for the food because of the slow service. Good food, good setting with lots of TVs, excellent hot salsa.

I went here for lunch on a Saturday with family. We sat down and waited for quite a while before being acknowledged by any of the staff. The staff got our orders correct and responded to our requests, but always in a rather slow fashion. They certainly were in no hurry.

The food was good. We asked for the spicy salsa to go with the chips they bring out at the beginning of the meal, and it was probably my favorite thing from the whole meal (but challenged closely by the carnitas burro). Not only was it the spice level I like (decently spicy, but not uncomfortable), but the flavor was excellent. I ordered two tacos (one grilled fish and one chicken) and the carnitas burro. The fish taco was decent, although the piece of fish in it was rather small. The chicken made me a little unsure as to whether it was breaded and fried or grilled, but with some of that salsa on it, it was pretty decent. But the star of my meal was the carnitas burro. It had an excellent flavor to it, and the carnitas had a nice texture that carnitas should have. My friend had the fajitas, which came out sizzling and looked pretty solid. There were lots of brightly-colored peppers to go with the steak, and the guacamole was good.

All in all, this is a solid choice for Mexican food in this part of town. Just don't be in a rush when you come here.

My wife and I saw a review and had to try it and we were not disappointed. If you haven't been here let me tell you the menu is huge don't let that scare you. My wife and I both got a three item plate, I got two ground beef tacos and a carne asada burro and added a cheese enchilada because I couldn't make up my mind. My wife got a flauta a carne asada burro and a ground beef enchilada. The food was amazing and the service was great. It's a Friday night and it was super busy but are sever Rosa was great and very attentive to us. My 18 month old even enjoyed the food we had to take turns giving her food to keep up with her. If your looking for really good Mexican food at a great price you have to try Baja Joe's. Next time we come I am trying their sea food it looks amazing.

Went on a Friday, there was live music.
The chopped salsa had a nice amount of friendly heat but a bit watery. Nice combo and a la carte options. I had the mixed greens with ranch - not usually a ranch fan, but it was good. Great service all around.

Great food, Great service, Can't ask for more!  Don't let the area and the decor stop you! Kick back, have and amazing margarita, and enjoy a night out! This is the first place I can honestly tell you that, I don't know if there was a T.V. in the restaurant because, I was so focused on the fun, atmosphere and food!

Always love coming to Baja Joe's for their food and margaritas! Everything on the menu is authentic tasting and their pina coladas are smooth and creamy (no ice chunks). Best mexican food I have ever had. Needs a bigger waiting room but that is the only bad thing I can say!

I have been here gobs and gobs of times. Taco Tuesday is my day. $2.00 tacos-- I always have the breaded shrimp taco with cabbage on a flour tortilla. Never disappointed.  The place gets really busy on Tuesdays by about 5:00 so be warned. They have a nice big outdoor patio and great drink prices for happy hour too. Only negative is service can be pretty spotty at busy times. Today-- early everything is awesome and the taco is delicious as ever!

my boyfriend and i went there tonight thinking that it was a nice place to eat.. oh how WRONG we were.. 
first of all, it was way too noisy and loud and we couldnt even hear each other, secondly things on their menu are way too overpriced.  i mean SERIOUSLY? it was ridiculous..
and last but not least,  THE FOOD. let me start off by saying i ordered a 1 item entree of a steak taco with spanish rice and beans.. and when they brought me out my meal, i just couldnt believe my eyes. what i got was a plain non seasoned steak meat on a plain tortilla. no cheese,lettuce or tomato or anything. and lukewarm rice and beans with cheese. and no flavor of any kind. it WAS DISGUSTING and gross. if i had wanted  plain meat on a tortilla,i would have asked for it that way.. and with the beans, it looked like someone had just dumped a spoonful on the plate with a clump of cheese and then threw the plate in the microwave. i was BEYOND disappointed, and i will  NEVER EVER set foot in that place again and would never recommend it to anyone... the food is BEYOND  HORRIBLE. and if i had it my way, i wouldnt give them any stars at all...
Gotta love Carmen.  She is a great bartender.   Funny, friendly and on point service.   Other servers a little slow.   Standing around talking instead of paying attention to customers

We had never heard of this place and so glad we got introduced to it! My husband and I absolutely love Mariscos and have always gone to Mariscos Sinaloa (48th Street) because we knew for sure we were guaranteed Mariscos there! Well, now that we met Baja Joe's we are completely sold! Service at both locations can be slow on a busy day or time, however, when you start comparing quality and portion size, Baja Joe's is a win! I had a shrimp cocktail (abulon, shrimp, octopus) and my fish bowl was seriously packed with seafood! Not just full of vegetables (cucumber, tomato etc.) like the other Mariscos restaurants. My husband had the Malificio (combination of oysters, scallops, drowned, shrimp  and octopus), which he too loved. We eat Mariscos quite a bit and have never experienced this and we will for sure return! They are not shy at all on their seafood portions. Thank you Baja Joe's!

PS..The salsa was extremely tasty and good, you need to try this place!

Don't come to this place unless you pay cash. The food was alright, I had the campechana especial, and my son had the chicken nuggets. Before placing my order, I had asked the waitress that was attending to the table I was at, her name is Janet, to please separate my son's and my order from the everyone else's bill, she refused to separate it, why? I don't know. Once coming to paying though, I asked her to give me my bill of what I had and my son had, and she wouldn't listen to me, she was looking at the other people I was sitting with, who told her not to, and I directly told her to ignore them that I was going to pay for my food which I had consumed as well as my sons. I handed her my card, told her to swipe it for MY bill, and instead she charged me the WHOLE tables bill, which was 202.49, when she brought me the ticket for me to sign, I was baffled on how she misunderstood me. I check my bank account, and it's -112 dollars because of the 202 pending on my account. And blamed my bank for holding the funds. Tuesday came by and still nothing. Now it's Wednesday June 24th, and it's STILL pending, I already went to my bank and the fault is in part of the business Baja Joe's, on my bank records, it showed that the amount of 202.49 was charged and approved, leaving me with a negative balance and a HORRIBLE experience. I am left to suffer because of Baja Joe's staff, who chose not to listen to her customer. Clearly they need to train their staff how to properly refund people, and to actually listen to their customers.

Good food, the peppers stuffed with shrimp and cream cheese are legit!! Very good seafood all the way around.
Great, authentic Mexican cuisine, generous portions, huge menu, friendly, helpful staff! Why not five stars? It is TOO good! The place is crowded, and noisy! Give it a try, you'll be glad you did!
Great food, very authentic, good atmosphere, and friendly staff. Overall a great experience.
Place was a bit dirty feeling loud and the food wasn't all that tasty. I did have a really enjoyable bar tender but that would be the only reason I returned.
Just mived to AZ from Los Angeles this place has amazing enchiladas and civiche I also recommend the green sauce for the enchiladas.

I cannot comment on the food but I can comment on the service. Our friends band was playing so we went to watch him on a Friday night. Our bartender was EXTREMELY rude and my husband and I were standing at an open space at the bar. The bartender came over and took our drink order and then never came back with our drinks. She kept looking over at us but never made the drinks. We thought maybe she was jus backed up but about 15 minutes later, we realized we weren't getting our drinks. We went to another guy at the bar and he was a bit friendlier and got the drinks pretty quick. I used to be a bartender so I know how busy they are but this lady was standing behind the bar talking to what seemed to be her bar back and acting a bit stuck up. I have a pretty low tolerance for women that treat people like this so we were over her pretty quick. The atmosphere and energy is fun - music is EXTREMELY loud.

Baja Joes is fantastic! Walking in, I forget I'm in Mesa & am immediately taken back to Rocky Point. My parents were the first to refer me here. Driving by, it's not a spot you'd typically think "hey, I should eat there!" Well, good thing you're reading this. You should eat there. - For an appetizer, order the bacon wrapped-shrimp stuffed-peppers, & allow them to change your life. I always order Carnitas or Carne Asada, I haven't gotten tired of it yet, since it's awesome. My boyfriend is faithful to their Siete Mares soup, which is very good as well! If you enjoy Mexican-Mexican over Gringo-Mexican, you'll find yourself delighted here.

Food was good unfortunately the bartender was completely out of line and rude. We walk in to have dinner and watch the bronco chiefs game (I'm wearing a bronco jersey) and sit down at the bar to be greeted by the bartender very rudely say my team is going to lose and he is going to "piss in my drink". I can take friendly rivalry but this is absolutely no way to treat a customer. His demeanor and attitude was disgusting during the entirety of our meal. Needless to say we left after our meal and watched the game elsewhere.

4/2- update
Went for breakfast. The chorizo plate was very good. Just the right amount of spice.  Wife had breakfast burrito that was huge. The chips were fresh and salsa was flavorful. 
Bloody Mary was good and Beers were ice cold. 
Servers were very nice and attentive.  

I'm leaving my original review but have been back multiple times since then and had much more positive experiences. 


Usually love this place. Went on Sunday for dinner. The food was not up to normal standards nor was the service. The chimichangas were too crisp and burned on the bottom. The fajita burrito meat had little flavor. I think the salsa was missing something too because it just tasted like tomatoes. I think the server forgot about us as we had to ask busser for drink refills and chips.  Also had to wait an extended period for our check. Will probably go back since it is close to home but the restaurant definitely has fallen on our list.

I like this restaurant. For one thing, I see a lot of Hispanic folks eating there. The wait staff is friendly and helpful to a degree you don't often luck into. The michelada (it's a mexican tomato beer) is a wonderful way to take beer. We've done four or five trips to this restaurant and both my wife and I have found the food to be excellent every time. They specialize in some sea food dishes if you like Mexican sea food. You get the feeling of dining in Mexico here. Good people, good food, good ambiance. We intend to do our part to keep this place going. It is kind of hidden in the little plaza at the corner of McKellips and Gilbert.
Order fish and shrimp grilled for tacos!!! So good! We sat outside today and they had two men playing authentic music. Great atmosphere :)

The service was definitely subpar and rude. The waitress spoke to us in Spanish knowing that we did not know it ourselves when we stared at her after she asked us questions and responded in English. She mixed our drinks and did not refill our chips and salsa because she wanted us to ask her to do it. She did not come to ask how our food was, we had to flag her down jus to get the check. She got my boyfriend's order wrong and did not attempt to fix it. He was served disgusting seafood skewers with large chunks of soggy fish and bitter tasting shrimp and tomatoes. The entire plate was soaked in butter for no reason, even his rice and side salad were wet which is very disgusting. It looked all very unappetizing considering all he asked for was shrimp skewers. After we told the waitress he was unhappy she did not even offer to remove the meal from our bill or replace it with anything else. I ended up covering the bill because I suggested the place thanks to many misleading reviews. My shrimp cocktail was decent but the shrimp was extremely salty and there was no cucumber, cilantro, tomato, onion or avocado in it. Just shrimp and juice. Worst experience ever.

I have had a few issues before at Baja Joe's, but I'm seeing some positive changes. It is great when the owner steps up and makes changes to improve on issues and complaints. I have been back to Baja Joe's and the new bar manager and the owner improving the service. It seems like they are moving in the right direction. I have to compliment David and the staff for my late Sunday evening visit. It was late and they were obviously cleaning and getting ready to close up. When sheepishly asked if we could still enjoy a beer at the bar, they were very friendly and welcoming us to stay. Like the positive attitude changes.

Baja Joes fish tacos are awesome!! Get them fried or grilled. I come at least 1 time a month if not more. Tuesday is tacos for $2 any taco you want. I suggest carnitas, fish and carne asada tacos. Waitresses are very friendly and do a great job! Weekends you get a chance to see mariachi!!

I'm sad to write this review because I love their food. Tonight, we dined in and ordered drinks and food, totaling $49. We paid and tipped $7 because I waited 5 minutes each time my drink was empty because one of the bartenders wanted to flirt with her regular customers. After closing , I decided to order two Don Julio shots, and the guy I knew that worked there asked the bartender to make them... we heard her talking about how we only tipped her $7 the first time around and then he proceeded to tell us we couldn't order those shots because the bar was closing, even though she had never made an announcement saying it was last call. There were plenty of people at the bar
.. She had the worst attitude because of her tip which she didn't deserve anyways because we had to wait for our drinks in the 1st place. Sad to not return to the place. The chefs were great there.

" I had a bad experience for the first time in 4 years here. Terrible customer service by the female bartender + Carlos ( bar back). Food is great but would rather order take out then sit. And get served by those two clowns...

Overall food quality was good. Wasn't impressed but not turned off to coming back. Believe in the rule of 3 (most places take 3 visits) . This being my first time, I have nothing to judge this experience on. Carna Asada was dry and over cooked. Shredded beef taco and enchilada were great.

We've traveled all over Mexico and most of the Southwest and appreciate most
Mexican cuisine.  Our experience is that few  U.S. Mexican restaurants offer
much (or any) seafood and what is offered seldom has a freshness you find
on the Mexican coasts.  Until now.

We found Baja Joe's Cantina (Gilbert Road, Mesa)  thanks to a Groupon offer
which led us to a non-descript strip center. Two steps inside, the atmosphere is
pure Mexican neighborhood ambience with simply the best selection of seafood
we've seen in the Valley. Not only many choices, but the best preparation and fresh taste.

Ever, the manager, greets every guest and is totally enthusiastic about his
menu and his staff. He mentioned losing many regular neighborhood customers
as the economy drove them back to Mexico, but his promotions have paid off
by bringing in new customers who never would have found the restaurant
otherwise. Everyone in the restaurant when we ate there was a repeat visitor,
so that shows how great the food is. We'll be back as well.

Don't wait for a coupon. Find Baja Joe's!

This restaurant is fantastic and a hidden gem in Mesa. Everything I tried was tasty. Good Mexican music and great atmosphere. I'll be back for a date night with my girl. Open around 9:am, breakfast as well as lunch or dinner of course.

Don't let the non-descript outside appearance scare you off. The food and service was very good. The fajita shrimp plate was nothing short of amazing. The service, spectacular. We ventured here on a friend's recommendation and will certainly be back. Be prepared, interior noise is quite loud.

I've been coming in here every Friday for about two years, all I can say great service, amazing authentic  Mexican cuisine, great $6.99 lunch special with $2 drafts! Check this place out Sean you are a great owner keep it up!

Ordered fajitas (steak) and ceviche to go..... the fajitas where really good and well served! Came with rice /beans and pico! Although the ceviche wasn't the best I've had but also not the worst! Definitely try the steak fajitas though!

Love the food here and the service has always been good as well.  The guacamole is so good, as are their margaritas.  If we lived closer we would go more often!  We have never ordered anything we did not like so I do not have any suggestions.

The food was pretty good...about 4 stars good.  The service is a different story...maybe 1 star and that is being generous.
We were basically ignored the whole time we were there by our server.  Took forever to get her to take our drink order and then when she did finally bring our drinks mine was wrong, had ordered a margarita with NO salt and of course it had salt.  I had ordered a side of sour cream and of course she forgot it, and once I realized this had to flag down a different server because our server had once again disappeared.  My husband asked for another when she brought our dinner out...10 minutes later no beer so asked the hostess to find our server since we had not seen her since she delivered the food.  When she did finally bring the beer blamed it on the bartender.  Never once did she come over to our table after bringing our meal out and asked us if everything was ok or if we needed anything else.  Let me add they were not busy at all so no excuse really for this horrible service.
This was our second visit to Baja Joe's, the first visit being a few months ago and had a wonderful server and a very pleasurable experience.  But after this last visit we won't be back.

I found a new fave today. The reviews were pretty right on. The food ROCKS! Got the Steak Picado Chimi and man it was the best I have ever had. The wait staff I am split on. I am not sure if it was because I ordered take out but the waitress that took my order seemed less than thrilled to be there and made no attempt at customer service. The second waitress that approached me asked me if I would like a glass of water while I waited and was very pleasent. In retrospect I should have gave her the tip lol
Baja Joe's is a cute little Restaurant with good authentic Mexican food. Good Service. I love their menudo and my husband says they have a pretty good stuffed burger.

Eat lunch here all the time.  Really love this place.  Quality is always good IMO but you  don't want to go here if you are in a hurry.  If you have 45 minutes for lunch you're good but less than that and it'll ruin your lunch.  

Fish Tacos, Lunch special Burro and the Burro special only in the bar are all great choices.  I keep meaning to try those stuffed peppers wrapped in bacon though.

After receiving a very nasty reply from the owner regarding my last review, I now wish that I could give this dump -5 stars. As a "professional business man" one would think that the owner would be open to critique that could better his business. Apparently, this is not the case at Baja Joes. Not only was the food horrid, the owner is also snide and condescending, cannot say that I am surprised. The food really is a reflection of their owner. I am absolutely taken aback by the amount of unprofessional (or lack thereof) from Baja J. The purpose of my last review was NOT to promote another business or "ride anyone's coat tails". I was simply leaving my honest opinion about several Mexican dishes that I know a GREAT deal about! Growing up in a Hispanic household, I KNOW what good/real Mexican seafood tastes like, and regrettably, you will not find either at Baja Joes. Baja J, I apologize if my previous review was too honest for you, however, you sir, need to learn some professionalism and respect! Please understand that this was my honest review of YOUR food and what needs improvement. Again this was MY honest review of YOUR restaurant. If I wanted to promote another restaurant I would leave a review on THEIR page, not yours! I am in NO WAY affiliated with any restaurant, if I was, don't you think that I would be promoting the heck out of it? Do your research Baja J, I have not even reviewed the establishment I mentioned previously. If I were you, I would take a serious look at your menu, recipes, and attitude because judging by other reviewers I am not the only one who has had these complaints. Do you belittle and undermine everyone who does not like your restaurant? Would you prefer that I say I have received better meals from Taco Bell, or would that be promoting another business as well? Future diners beware, if you do not care for their food you will be publicly chastised for your honest opinion. The owner will not try to remedy the situation or make up for the fact that you wasted $65 on a terrible experience. Heck, he wont even apologize that you had a bad meal. Absolutely inexcusable.
Had the ceviche tostada, mister had the carne asada tacos. Both were ok. Queso fundio for an app. not good. Service was slow and I probably wouldn't go back.

Came here again with the whole family (6of us) after a first successful evening. Once again, the service was remarkable and the owner very friendly. The food we ordered was the whole red snapper, the fish tray, and the sistes martes ( I know I spelled that wrong but it was the soup of the seven seas). I have it 4 stars again because of this. 

I got the whole fish because I thought it would be basically 2x the size of the fillet. It was definitely not, and it was a little too cooked / breaded so there was hardly any meat and way too much work. The taste still was great, but I will definitely opt for the filet next time. The seafood platter was very impressive. Everything's was cooked absolutely to perfection. The only downside was that it was pretty salty on some pieces. The red fish ( I have no idea  what it was called but it was straight out red) was my favorite because it was cooked so amazingly. It's not easy to deep fry such a small piece of fish and have it come out perfectly! Because it is all fried,  I would not recommend getting just that because I personally would get sick of it, but since we all also shared the fish (tacos) and soup, the meal was very balanced. Moving on to the soup, it was pretty good. It was cool to see snails in it as they are hard to find in AZ. It was full of different seafood which my family really enjoyed, but the broth was a bit bland. I was expecting a bouillabaisse tasting broth but it was a slightly fishy chicken broth. I'm not sure we would get that again but it's definitely a mellow flavor if you like that. Overall even though the food should have served 4 people, the 6 of us were exploding and had to work hard to finish everything. And the prices (I think $60) was so totally worth it! I mean it's hard to find such fresh seafood in AZ, but Baja joes nails it and the prices are reasonable and the portions are massive. We will definitely make this one of our regulars.

I was a bit skeptical at first for trying this place because I haven't seen it advertised much (which doesn't necessarily mean it's good but...). We walked in and the atmosphere is fun as there are sea murals painted on all the walls and overall it's very clean. They played top 40-type music as well which added to the atmosphere. There is an adjoining bar, along with an outdoor patio.

The food was great too. The salsa was very good, which is how I usually judge a Mexican food restaurant. The food was delicious and presented very well. It wasn't just slapped on the plate and you can tell there is some care to it. I ordered a chicken tostada plate and it was very flavorful. The chicken is marinated and was awesome. The plate comes with salad as well, in addition to the normal rice and beans. My son ordered a chicken quesadilla and it was great. It had a ton of meat. My husband ordered the enchilada plate and it was tasty.

The pricing is VERY reasonable. 

The service is awesome too! Our waitress stopped by our table at least 4 times during the course of our meal. Our food arrived quickly and we never lacked drinks. You can tell they really care about service.

We will be back! Glad I tried this place.
Tacos were awesome. Had carnitas, chicken and steak and all were delicious. The margaritas were even better and priced exceptionally well during their happy hour.

I want to really love this place the food has potential. The problem was we went Friday night and it's really a bar a place for a good time to have drinks if you can't make it to cabo this weekend. I had a long week and wanted to spend quality time with the fianc. It was so noisy she got a head ache and we had really slow service. No refills. No checking back to see if the food was okay. I uploaded a picture and they have a five dollar off Yelp promotion but it was not worth the time it took to get the bill adjusted. I'm going with we got unlucky with a new waitress because usually I can tell if the Diet Coke is good they are at the very least servicing the soda machine that is generally a good sign. I'll have to give them another chance for lunch I see lunch specials that look really good. This was just a really painful experience from the moment we got the guac made at our table until the end. It started off good but maybe the time it took for the waitress to make the guac at the table set a chain of events in motion that caused us to have to sit there for over an hour in an extremely noisy bar with lots of drunk people having a good time.

First time I tried this place I ordered a large ceviche, although the ceviche tasted great I felt I over payed for the amount that I got and I was extremely disappointed. I could have gone to my regular place for a better deal.

Been there for lunch quite a few times and is good for lunch. Never tried there more expensive seafood fare but it looks good. 

Great stand by

Had dinner here with my wife and friends from out of town. It seemed like it's more of a bar than a restaurant, at least in the evening. The food was good though. Beer was cold. So five stars for being a bar and grill , and having good food and cold beer.
I got the nachos and for $10 I expected real cheese but was sadly disappointed to have gotten nacho cheese. Won't be coming back.
Pretty yummy Mexican food,  I live nearby here and I never bothered to go here until my friend suggested it.  Their burritos are amazing!

We were driving around trying to find an outdoor dining  place big enough, just in case the kids wanted to walk around. Being in East Mesa, places are soooo limited. Stumbled upon this restaurant after driving around, and lets face it, Mexican food is pretty damn tasty. 

Got here and it is nice, clean and bright. No one's at the front, but we don't wait more then a minute for a hostess to greet us and seat us outside--which is where wanted to be at 78 degrees in AZ. 

The waitress comes and greets us quickly and asks for drink orders. We get my sons order, by we wait 10 min about for our beer and margarita orders. A little long but she did apologize for the wait and was genuine about it. He margaritas were a good deal! They were $8 for about 14oz. I think it was well worth it!

Put in our food orders and they came out rather quickly as well. Both me and my fianc got shrimp and my son had chicken fingers. The chicken fingers weren't that hot which was a plus. My fried shrimp was yummy and the fiancs shrimp quesadilla was definitely enjoyable. I liked that for my side salad they used a greener lettuce and not just general iceberg.

Had to order desert, which was a homemade flan and it was was creamy and delicious! 

For Mesa, a good restaurant on enjoy:)

This place get one star because the service is and has always been bad. We waited 15 min before someone came to us and helped us. Keep in mind the place wasn't busy at all. Yet the waitress just talking with one another. The food is good for the location where it's at. This wasn't the first time I've waited that long it's been 3 times. I'm not spend my money here anymore. 3 opportunities is more then what i should of gave.
The food was OK but the noise of the restaurant was unbearable. We left very frustrated as we could not talk to anyone in our party.

We've been here a couple of times now and I love the place! We walked in there you feel like you're in a restaurant in Rocky point Mexico. It's got a really cool coastal beach theme. The menu is rather large and has a lot of options. It is a bit cumbersome to understand in parts of the language barrier. Service on both times that we went was exceptional. They have a ceviche tostada on happy hour that is knock your socks off fantastic. That with a cold Corona light draft beer you can't go wrong. My only negative issue was there's a male manager that walks around the dining room on both occasions with a cold and stern look on his face and seems really uninviting. He stopped at our table to clear off some table settings and didn't even speak to us which I thought was disconcerting. I find the parking lot a bit sketchy to as the first time we were there there were people walking out of the restaurant with Bud lights in her hand heading towards her vehicles and the second time there was a couple of good old boys in the parking lot with the tailgates of their trucks down sipping on a bottle of Jack Daniels. Does it give the place very good curb appeal. Other than that this place is rockstar!

Great food, service and lively atmosphere. Very friendly and attentive staff. The seafood selection is diverse and priced right. They  have a bar with TVs if that's your thing and an open Dining room. Try the shrimp stuffed bacon wrapped jalapeos or the ceviche tostadas!
Ordered food at bar got wrong food and bartender told me..Hey its good I like that just try it. Drink was made wrong. Happened twice with same bartender.

Only been here twice.  The service kinda sucks.  Normally don't give bad reviews. But my last experience was terrible. The first time the service took a while even though it was not busy at all.  The food was okay. Just as any other typical cantina fish fry. The second experience was worse.   Came in with my best friend for some food and drink.  We got his drink and we looked at the menu.   Decided what we wanted and sat at the bar for 15 to 20 minuets.  Waitress was just talking to other customers which is fine.  Refilling their drinks and stuff.  Passed by us multiple times. Something was wrong with the bar sink behind the counter and the manager was there watching another employee fix it.  After it was fix the manager was just standing there watching people come in and out the door. Not once did he ask would you like to order.  Finally he did.  "Are you guys going to order?"   Really?  We only have menus here just to look.  "Not anymore,  can we just pay for the drink"  we just paid for the drink and left.  What kinda customer service is that?  They wernt't even busy.  I don't expect a lot but that experience wasn't good at all.

The owner is very friendly and engaged, and the food is very good.  I ate while my kids skateboarded at Kids that Rip next door, so very convenient if you want to stay close.  I ordered a carne asada taco (it rocked), shredded beef taco and bean tostada (ok, not spectacular).  Margaritas are good.  Ambiance is bright, simple, and somewhat authentic - meaning I could see this place being in a border town, complete with mariachi tunes on the stereo.  I'll come back.

I have always been impressed with the food quality and the attentive service at this Baja Joe's. The food is authentic and the portions are generous. Management makes extra effort to make sure everything is great.

Came with my hyper 6 year old after an evening of fun. The restaurant portion was full but there was immediate seating in the high tops by the bar (which works perfect because she can get up or watch tv without bothering anyone). Our server Shannon was obviously busy and quick to take orders, but as soon as the crowd cleared out she was very attentive and fun! Our food took a little to come out (nothing excessive.. maybe 20 mins?) so we were offered free dessert. Fried ice cream is my daughters favorite so she chose that and told Shannon it's almost her birthday (almost 2 weeks away).. Shannon came out with the birthday portion and sang her happy birthday with a lit tortilla chip. The food was delicious and very large portion. She and I shared the carne asada and still have tons left over. Bill was only $23 for carne aside, a margarita, a soda and our free fried ice cream. Definitely will be back.

I had heard a few good reviews of this place so my husband and I stopped in for dinner one night. The atmosphere is a little loud and the staff seemed pretty busy. We ordered a beef chimi and a fajita burrito deluxe. They were both ok, nothing to go out of your way for.

We had a horrible experience at this place. The food was mediocre and the service was horrible!!!! Clara was our server...we had to ask her 4 times for water. It was over an hour before she finally broght one cup of water but we asked her for 3. Our friend's food never came out, so she finally cancelled her order and didnt eat! Our waitress never once checked on us to see if we needed anything, and when she delivered items she only appeared tondeliver one item at a time. Then she added automatic gratuity, which is just unethical as she knew she did not earn a tip!!!! We will never go back!

I loooove Baja Joes!! Such a great place to go for margs, chips and salsa any time of the day and be greated by freindly staff. When we go, we sit at the bar. Sometimes just drinks, chips and salsa other times we get tacos. They have amazing fish tacos....seriously. The fried one is the best. I still get a grilled shrimp taco, but my boyfriends fish taco is always better. Reason said is well, it just has great flavor and the bottle of taco chipotle sauce is super good. I just like shrimp tacos though....

Reason that even though I love this place they only get 3 stars is because my shrimps taco is inconsistent in both price and flavor and size...sometimes there is like 8-10 shrimps, the last time there was four, it was pathetic for a five dollar taco that ended up being even more because for some reason the waitress charged me an extra $1.75 on top of the five bucks for "grilled" I didnt eorder any fixings on it except cabbage, nothing else and the menu clearly states grilled or fried, same price. So for $6.75 I got an extremely dissapointing excuse of a cook that didn't give a crap, a waitress who overcharged and an empty stomach. Step it up Baja Joes!! We come here alot, I want to continue that trend. But there are plenty of fish tacos in this sea... If you check in on Yelp you get five bucks off.

This placed USED to be great, BUT they switched to Pepsi, yuck! More than half the reason I came here was for Coke. The food just doesn't taste good anymore without coke. Won't be coming back. Too many other good Mexican restaurants that serve coke that I'll be supporting.

Everything was amazing.  Food, service, price, we will for sure be back.   The staff was busy because the place was packed but the service was exceptional.  Very friendly and checked on us multiple times.  They don't have tamales but the chili rellenos are dynamite.   Chips fresh, salsa fresh.  It was all so yummy.
The food was awesome & so was the service!!!! It was my 1st time going & my husband & I were very impressed!!! We will be coming back! It was a Great Date Night!!!
This is a Mesa gem. Carmen, the bartender was the best. Family atmosphere is nice and service never disappoints.  Best way to down your Sunday.
This place is so so good!!! Clean (for a change) mariscos place. Very nice wait staff and delicious food. also, the micheladas are excellent!

Prices have gone UP!! Daily and after 8pm specials aren't as good now. The IPA they have on tap is not included in the after 8 special?! :( 

The javi-hot wings are tasty. The "stuffed" burger is just two patties.

The service was excellent, as was the guacamole! I had the shrimp quesadilla which was so good and my husband had the shrimp enchilada's which he really liked a lot. Our compliments went to the chef. The atmosphere was a bar atmosphere. I had a virgin margarita which was just ok and my spouse had 2 regular margaritas which he felt were weak and had a soapy taste...but he had 2 so I guess they weren't that bad. Bottom line - food & service were excellent, atmosphere and drinks just so so. We did use the $5 coupon with absolutely no problem. Dinner was $48 + tip. I would absolutely return!

I had the seafood enchiladas. The food was pretty good, and the margarita was potent. The crowd on a Saturday night was hilarious. There was live music and plenty of people dancing without a care. I was not mad at that at all!

Had dinner last night for first time at the restaurant. The service was absolutely terrible. We sat down and waited for 10 minutes until a waitress came and took our drink order. Every table had chips and sausa, we had to ask for them. We had to ask for the spice tray, which every table had one, and when our entre's came, I had to send mine back as it wasn't what the menu said it was. At every other table, the patrons had water, we were given any or asked if we wanted any. Very disappointing.  I will not return or recommend the restaurant to our friends.
Love this place! Ceviche, fish, shrimp, lobster, it doesn't matter  love it. Its a fun place to eat especially when they bring out the big old flaming clay fish with a ton of seafood on top.
Service is ok the original is better.  Hate the music mis the original mexican music.  This is not ligit.

Tried this after reading the four star reviews. Our experience didn't match up. Came with my wife and kids. None of us were impressed. Enchiladas were bland. The ranchera sauce was way different than other places I've had ranchera and I disliked it. My wife strongly disliked the chili relleno. Strongly disliked the queso - evidently it's a style that seems to use a heavy base of flour, creme, and mild cheese I'm guessing? Not in my preferred taste. Anyway, cool murals on the wall and fun atmosphere but I found the flavors and food textures pretty bland.

Mixed reviews from our group.  My carnitas was very salty yet my husband's steak burrito was delicious.  Our party of 6 was charged an automatic gratuity.  Not a big deal but we did not know in advance about this.  Our waitress had a hard time keeping the orders straight and had to re-do a few things but it all worked out.  Chips and salsa were great.
Service is mediocre. Food is pretty good!!! Stick with the seafood!! Got the cevichi tostada, it was yummy!!!
Great spot. Excellent grilled chicken salad! Baha burrito was delicious. Kids chicken tenders and fries were a big hit, too. Highly recommend!

This was my first time at Baja Joes and I'm afraid I was unimpressed.

We ordered Shrimp cocktail, Garlic shrimp and Ceviche. - three staple Mexican dishes.

The cocktail was watery and has frozen shrimp

The garlic shrimp was swimming in oil, the four slices of potato were undercooked and the rice was burnt - also the shrimp was still in its shell whilst swimming in oil which made it virtually impossible to de-shell.

The ceviche was average at best.

The house lemonade was lovely and the service was pretty good but the meal was not worth $50

I'm afraid I won't be going back.
Great mexican flavors. We often come for lunch and have never been dissapointed. The deep fryed icecream is a meal in itself!

This place is definitely not what I expected. The food was really good but not THE BEST food. The salsa was good and slightly spicy. The fish wasn't seasoned all that great, and not crispy. Beans were real good. Service was nice, friendly and attentive. The price was reasonable. Happy hour seems real nice, and the Sunday football specials sound real good. The decor was fun and colorful.

Horrible service.  Gross food. Everyone we saw was eating shrimp cocktail or ceviche. Because the Mexican food is horrible. The enchilada sauce tasted like chili sauce. And the chicken was disgusting.  Don't go there.
I've been eating here for years and have never had a bad meal. I think it would be more well known except it's kind Zofran hidden in a corner. Nice people good food. What else is there?

Baja Joe's is definitely a MUST try before you die! Not only is the service impeccable, the food is extremely delicious! First we started with some chips, salsa and guacamole (which they made fresh at the table). The chips were warm and crispy and the salsa was top notch. My bf got the combo platter choosing the shrimp taco and carne asade enchilada as his two items. The shrimp was cooked to perfection and the beans and rice that came with it were awesome too! But lets get down to the important matter, what I got. A friend had recommended the whole fish so I ordered the whole garlic red snapper. I was more than impressed! It was crispy and extremely flavorful, could have probably fed 2-3 people so I had a lot for leftovers. The meat of the fish tasted really fresh, came right off and I didn't get any bones. They provided tortillas and I was able to make a super delicious fish taco that included the crispy garlic fish, rice (that came with the fish) and their special chipotle sauce and spicy salsa ( provided on the table). Baja Joe's is my favorite Mexican Cantina by far, and that is counting all the ones have been too (even in California). My friend got the crazy seafood platter that had everything on a boat with a flame underneath and he enjoyed it very much. They also have margaritas served by the pitcher for $19 and it was worth it. I STRONGLY recommend giving this hidden gem a try!! Scouts honor this place is AWESOME!

At first, I almost walked out because the chips tasted horrible! We brought it to the waitresses attention and she promptly replaced them with fresh chips that were fantastic! The salsa is chunky with a little heat which I like and they also have a great extra hot salsa that has very good flavor even though It was quite spicy. 

I had a chicken fajita chimichanga that had great flavor and really hit the spot. We also had a beef burrito that was very delicious. I can see why this is a favorite for the locals and I'm glad we found it!

Alright, I'm gonna preface this in the interest of fairness with that we generally really like Baja Joe's. My fianc used to come in here pretty often with co-workers, and we go for Taco Tuesday frequently. The menu is huge and almost everything has been really good. I am obsessed with the fish tacos and the chipotle sauce. 

The thing I am steamed about is how we were treated last night. 
We came in to have dinner and some drinks. Bartender asks what we want to drink. I noticed the big chalkboard sign on the wall, said "Oh look, $3 margaritas" and ordered one.

She brought it in a huge glass but we thought nothing of it, because that is what you will get for $4 Happy Hour at most Mexican joints. 

The bill comes & it's $8. My fianc flags a different bartender down & inquires. She says "Oh yeah that's a mistake, sorry... The blonde girl? Yeah it's her first night, I'll go get her". 

Blonde bartender comes around the corner and I would never have guessed it was her first night, by the way she lectured us about it. "That was a BIG one, that was 18 oz. It's only for the smalls. We have a small and a large."  We tell her we didn't ask for a big one, the sign didn't specify anything besides "Margs". She cops a fake sickly sweet tone and goes to fetch the bar manager. 

Bar manager comes around the corner and before we can say a word, pops off with her own defensive tone. "The best I can do is bring it down to $6, because that was a big one". 

That was the tipping point for me. We eat here enough that the waitresses recognize us. When fiance's coworkers want to go out after work, that's where they bring their business. This bar manager has met him enough times that her business card has been on our fridge for a couple years. We aren't asking for special treatment, and $5 is not a huge deal, but it felt like we were being baited and switched (honestly, it sounds similar to what some other reviewers mention). Then, especially being regular customers, for both a brand new bartender and the manager to speak to us like that really, really rubbed me the wrong way. 

She eventually did take it back to $3, after I left in a huff & my level-headed partner reasoned with her. Damage done though. The entire time we were treated like morons, and we should not have had to go through 3 people and 4 conversations to get such a minor thing taken care of. It will be a long time before we go back if this is the new standard of customer treatment.

This review is based only on the bar and only on service, or lack thereof! 
I came in mid week, about 5 pm. The restaurant was moderately busy but I decided to sit at the bar. That's where I made my mistake. I found a spot and sat. And sat and sat (you get the idea). There were several people behind the bar acting very busy. Apparently too busy to greet the recently seated newcomer. People on either side of me received drink and food orders but the servers never stayed long enough for me to get their attention. 
Needless to say, I won't be going back to try the food.

I ate dinner here with my elderly parents.  We were a little hesitant at the front door because the place looks more like a bar than a restaurant from the outside but were pleasantly surprised once inside.  The place was packed even for a Friday night, probably because the food and service are excellent for the price.  Baja Joe's specialty is fish and shrimp, but they also have a full page of their menu devoted to standard Cali-Mex things if people want that instead.  We shared an order of jalapenos stuffed with shrimp and wrapped in bacon, then we ordered a two-item combo, shrimp taco salad and fish and chips special as entrees.  Everything from the steak in my taco to the rice and salsa were nicely prepared and tasty.  The salad lettuce was fresh and crispy, and portions were pretty generous.  Service staff were all friendly, attentive and patient, which is remarkable in light of how busy the place was.

Came to have dinner with the family, everything was delicious. The ceviche was perfect. We finished our wonderful meal w some great flan. Service was great even though it was extremely busy. Would definitely come back.

Sadly this place has gone downhill in the past year but prices have gone up! They now charge $7.99 for lunch specials and no longer provide free chips and salsa. The chips and salsa now cost additional $1.99.  I realize that costs have gone up as a result of the minimum wage increase, but the quality has gone downhill. The chips are often stale, and the food does not taste as fresh and is often over salted.  I loved this place in 2016, I do not think I will be a regular now.

Very large menu. I had a steak fajita burrito while the wife had fish and chips. Chips and salsa were good, although I would have appreciated the chips being warmed. Very reasonable prices. Will definitely return.
It's so sad we used to love coming here as a family but the prices keep going up. Now they charge for each round of chips and salsa. Sadly not sure if this will be our go to spot anymore.

Tried them out on a Saturday night.  Great food and plenty of it.  My wife had the shrimp something and the shrimp was great.  Great service and fresh chips and salsa.  A little more expensive than your Mexican fast food, but well worth it.

First, the food was 'homemade' good................

The service, not so much.

Wednesday night, 7PM. Several parties in the waiting area. Bartender and another person saw us and Ignored us. I finally went and asked, and they said a server would be right there. Server comes and tells all of us, seat yourself where ever you want. 

Ordered margarita's and took the waitresses advice. We took our time with the menu as there a lot of choices, and not the normal fare. 

Finally ordered, still no drinks, and then waitress suggests an appetizer to try next time we are there as I told her it was our first time. So we ordered the appetizer, yellow peppers, wrapped in bacon and stuffed with Shrimp!! GOOD!!!!

Margarita's finally came as the bartender had to deliver (apologized for the delay), as the waitress was under age. 

The apps come, no silverware. We had  stopped a bus boy to get water and napkins. Of course we had JUST gotten our drinks.

Then 20-25 minutes later the main course. Again good, but I ordered a burro and got a chimi version which I did not want, but did not want to wait anymore and did not take them up on the offer to redo it..

Again, food was great!! 

Bill comes and not only did they STILL charge for the Chimi instead of the burro I ordered, but we realize they brought us one LARGE Marg, which we did not ask for. So apparently you HAVE to specific to get a normal size.

SO although we enjoyed the unusual and tasty fare (We saw Guacamole made table side and their Chipolte sauce is made there too.) 90 minutes and two mistakes later it just was NOT worth it. At the VERY least she should have NOT charged for the Chimi that was more expensive than what I ordered.

I guess this diamond in the rough has now been discovered.  There were no tables available inside at lunch.  The patio does have shade and a misting system but I prefer to stay inside when it is hot out so we had a little wait. I ordered the lunch special for $8.99.  It was steak and shrimp fajita's and was fantastic!  My husband ordered off the menu and had the grilled steak and it was also fabulous.  I preferred mine because it came with the typical veggie's, guacamole, (YUM) pico de gallo, rice, beans and tortillas.  My pet peeve about ordering fajita's out is that most places don't give you enough tortillas and you can never find a staff person to bring you more.  Not only that, but if I have left overs to take home I need tortillas.  DUH!!  Not here, they provided the exact amount of tortillas needed and plenty for my leftovers.  They served a full serving even at a reduced price and I really appreciated it.  They are even offering a yelp deal that I just noticed if you want to give it a try.  The seafood and steaks are what to order here. Service is amazing!  Just saying.......................

I absolutely love this place. It's kinda like a half sports bar half Mexican restaurant.

The meat has so much more flavor than other places, It tasted like they grill the meat using charcoal. 

I usually get the fajitas or the paqueta de asada ( I hope I spelled that right).

They always have good happy hour and daily specials and not to mention hot chicks working behind the bar.
It's definitely my type of place. 

Can't wait to go back!

This was totally unexpectedly delicious!! I ordered the fajitas and now I crave them all the time!! Anytime my husband or I get fajitas anywhere else, we compare them to Baja Joe's. So far none of them have lived up to them! My mom and husband didn't love their meals, but they both loved my fajitas. The atmosphere is definitely casual and has some interesting wall murals. I would've eaten outside, but there was smoking allowed on the patio.

The fish tacos are awesome! Great size and on Tuesdays the prices cant be beat. Shared a plate of 12 wings with a coworker and had 2 fish tacos myself and the bill was less then $10. Get the fish tacos with breaded finish on either the flour or corn tortillas, both are good.
They made me a veggie burrito that was outstanding. Service at the bar was great and the bartender is fantastic. I will definitely come back here again.

The food here is really good!  I had the ceviche tostadas and rice and beans and I ate every bite!  The chips are home made and yummy. Overall I want to try a million things on the menu. Big menu too lots of Baja style seafood!  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the service was slow and lacking. We stood at the door for 5 min and no one told us to seat ourselves even though staff walked past us several times without saying anything. Our waitress took forever. We were there nearly 2 hrs for lunch. Then had to wait 15 min for the waitress to bring our check after we already told her we were done. The prices are good. And their lunch combos are only $5.99

We've been here for lunch three times now and have NEVER been disappointed.  To start, the decor is super.  It makes you feel like you are in a little cantina along the Mexican coast.  The menu is extensive with a wide variety of choices and very good prices.  The wait staff is great and very attentive.  The food is so amazing.   We've gone to a  lot of different Mexican restaurants and this is probably the best and most authentic.  You will not be disappointed with anything you order.  The combo plates are super deals and come with whatever you choose (taco, enchilada, etc.), beans, rice, salad and a really refreshing orange slice.  We absolutely LOVE this place and will come back often.

Sean the owner is absolutely awesome. Come try this place out. Give him your honest feed back (good or bad) and he takes it to heart. I love the carne asada! The guacamole they make at your table is also very good! We went last night on a very busy night (mother's day in Mexico, which we didn't know) but for how busy it was we got served pretty quickly. Our waitress was super sweet even with all the chaos of the crowd. Thanks Sean for caring about your customers!! :O)
Great food, great service! Food comes very quickly and so the drinks! Love the live band and the employed are always smiling and delightful! Fun, Fun!!!
Every time I've eaten here, my food has come out cold. Doesn't matter what meal- breakfast, lunch, dinner- I have yet to be impressed. Good if you're looking for a quick fix.
Chips and salsa were a 2. Runniest salsa I have ever had. Soupy. My shrimp enchiladas were ok. This is a bar restaurant where the mexican food is barely average. Service was good.

We were staying the weekend in AZ and we got in a little late on Friday. There was a large group of us that were starving after the long drive from Las Vegas. There weren't a lot of restaurants open late but I found this place on Yelp. 

Everyone at the table loved their food. The restaurant was busy but the service did a pretty good job, their were some minor mistakes but nothing that wasn't easily fixed. I also want to add that they have really delicious Micheladas!!! If I'm ever back in Mesa I would definitely come back her to eat again.

Ok, so for the most part of the almost 26 years I have lived here in Mesa I never knew there was a Mexican Restaurant at this location. Now I know this is a new owner as of this past January and was under a different name, but come on. I used to go to the Chinese Restaurant right off of Gilbert in the same shopping plaza, this place is kinda hidden, but wow I think you will all like this place. 
Once you walk in, it is a bright and colorful decoration, bar to the left and main restaurant ahead and when it cools down a patio out to the right outside the restaurant. Very nicely decorated patio, I must say, I can't wait till it cools down. 
On to the food.... I got the tacos and my girlfriend got the chimichanga and that came with fresh salad and fresh meat and vegetables in the chimi. The tacos were just as good. The manager of the place, Everett was probably one of the nicest guys, not fake either, which is a change for the restaurant industry. Cause you know how that goes, How is your meal, folks. Like you really give a crap, just shut up and let me eat in peace. This guy really cared and wanted to help grow this business. He also introduced us to the Michelada con Cervesa, A fancy way of saying adding your beer to Clamato Juice, lime juice, hot sauce, soy sauce and pepper and other seasonings, WHICH was awesome!!! Never would of tried it, Thanks Everett!!! 
Good Luck with the place, We will definitely tell everyone we know and recommend this to all. Please drive pass Serrano's and Tia Rosa's and check this place out. 
Great flavor, Fresh food and not watery and running all together on your plate, like the normal places.

Nestled inside a Mesa strip mall never did I believe that they would sell amazing mexican/mariscos type food. I am happy they proved me wrong. My friends and family come here a few times a month. Their shrimp platters have been big winners with our family. We have always ordered the ceviche tostadas, bacon wrapped shrimp, Shrimp el Diablo, and Shrimp Empanizados. The tortillas they serve on the side are also buttery and yummy. Everyone who has served us has been very professional and go above and beyond for us to have the best dining experience.
I highly recommend Baja Joes to anyone looking for fresh Mexican or Seafood!
This place rules. Cold beer good nachos great prices. The chips and salsa is the best and you can get it to go for like $3. BUCKS

Went here on a Sunday, I had a party of 5 so they told us the wait was 10-15 min. so ok we waited. A party of 4 came 5 min after us and they were seated right away. Then a party of 9,6 and finally 4 again. By this point 30 min had already passed and no one had come to us to tell us that our table would be ready shortly. After another party of 6 showed up and were seated right away I had it! I spoke to the host and the only think she could say to me was that the booth was for 4 people and they could not seat 5. The party of 6 and 9 were seated on one of the big tables because, I think, if you have a party of 6 or more the tip is automatically included on the check. I was kind of rude with the host because she just said you have to wait more. I asked to speak to the manager and he really didn't seem to care. However, he did seat us in a table that was reserved for a party of 9 at 3 pm, it was already 3:40!!! 5 minutes after we were seated a waitress said that we needed to move because I guess the party that had reserved the table had arrived 45 minutes after their reservation. But no we said the manager seated us here and we are not moving! Horrible experience!!! After we order we could see the waitresses talking to each other and looking at our table, I was worried that they had put something in our food!!! I felt super uncomfortable after that and just left! I will not be going back. Hope they work on their customer service for future clients!

I used to have to drive down to Guadalupe (the city not the street... well, actually, in Guadalupe, on Guadalupe, actually) for Mariscos like this, now I drive a mile or two down the street. Awesome! The wait staff is great... friendly, prompt, accommodating. I really enjoy their food and have had 3 different shrimp dishes and sampled 3 or more of the fish dishes. They are all delicious and the rice and potatoes they serve with the meals is a real treat also. 

I especially like the fact that they are knowledgeable about their ingredients and can tweak a lot of the recipes to make their dairy-free. They will use oil instead of butter on request making this an easy spot for people who don't eat dairy.

I waited with 2 other customers for almost 10 minutes at the door. No hosts. Got the fish & chips for lunch. First, no tartar sauce. The ranch & chipotle sauce are both very runny. The food was hot, but under-seasoned. And the music was very loud. In addition, the managers were standing right next to my table talking very loudly while putting up a sign on their miniscule salad bar. I dont have a reason to drive here again. It's ok at best.

Went to Baja Joes for lunch.  I ordered the two fish tacos lunch special.  It was okay.  It is worth noting that there is no host at the door, and there were many people waiting to be acknowledged including me.  They need to be more attentive.  

If you want Mexican style seafood go elsewhere.  Thanks.

We love this place. Amazing fajitas. Great atmosphere. Really good chips. The shrimp fajitas serve more shrimp than I could eat.

This place is great! I can enthusiastically recommend everything we ordered: the table-side guacamole, the fish chimichanga, and the bacon-wrapped crab-stuffed shrimp. BACON-WRAPPED? CRAB-STUFFED? Yes. Seriously. Good quality seafood, flavorful and unique dishes, awesome service, nice clean atmosphere, aquatic murals. I'm glad we gave this place a try.

Came here for father's day and while it was busy and we had to wait, completely worth it. A great Mexican restaurant in this town isn't too hard to come by, but a stellar one like this place is. Thanks for the great food

Came here based on other Yelp reviews. It was very good. Best in the area that we have discovered.
Eat here. You'll like it!
The atmosphere is great and the people are fun. I've never had a bedtime here. The bartenders are super friendly and take care you.

I have been going here for almost 2 years. The last two times I have gone I have said I will never come back. I kept hoping that the next time would be better. Today will be the last time I will ever go here. It has gone down hill fast in the last two years. Service was terrible and there were 3 people at the hostess station standing around doing nothing but sitting on their phones. Save your money do not go here.

I bought a Groupon for Baja Joe's after checking out the great ratings on Yelp!  Easy to visit when I go to the East Valley to visit my hateful mother,  my partner and I visited on a Friday night. The place was happy, relaxed and busy.

The food was above average in every way. Great chips (really) and a salsa that had a little kick. Just a little. For an appetizer we ordered the Supreme Nacho and we were blown away. The chips were smothered in a cheese sauce that tasted more like a cheddar fondue. We totally scoffed down the tasty flavored shredded beef, beans, sour cream and guacamole. Best. Nachos. Ever.

My Stuffed shrimp w/crab and wrapped in bacon, was good but  a little dry. The sides of were wonderful rice and potatoes reminded me of spanish restaurants in New Jersey where I am from. Next time I will try their traditional food like shredded beef enchiladas . My partner ordered three tacos- on fish and two carne asada and he was very happy except no baja sauce for his fish taco. His refried beans were creamy and delicious with the mexican rice.

Baja Joe's is a great value and it really is a nice atmosphere like a neighborhood hangout. 

Still dreaming of those nachos, and will bring my hateful mother there for her birthday next month.

Man this place is going downhill... Bartender was pretty good, other young bartender was too busy flirting and flexing and paying undivided attention to the old drink regular that was super inappropriate to everyone who walked it. I went outside for a minute and left my sister in law in the cantina and that drink side decided he wanted to be inappropriate to her. As soon as I walked back in he went back to his corner of the bar. I found out they got rid of the jukebox which sucked since they were playing 90's. I asked if they could play some country which they did but they had to argue and explain to the drunk regular why. He had the balls to talk crap from across the bar and instead of just calming him, they told him I asked for the country music and how they would only do a couple songs then change it back... Yes your right... Please the drunk inappropriate regular, and screw anyone else... The toritos were pretty good they were a tad salty. The cantina burrito however tasted like dog food. I don't think I'll be heading back there.

Had a family get together here, Saturday night. Sat on patio.
Service was great, friendly and efficient.
As usual, we all loved the food and drink. Had 2 of the Platillado de Mariscos, shared by all along with some apps.
The bacon wrapped shrimp, always a favorite. 
Manager checked with us, to make sure everything ok.
Can't wait to return.
Worst food I ever tasted. Only bottled hot sauces, no fresh salsa. Skirt steak was horrible , no flavor very bland. Very disappointed:( wouldn't never here again!!!
Great home style Mexican food. Nice seafood dishes and good service. I love the relaxed vibe.
Food and service are great, bartenders are very attentive,  becoming a regular here, very comfortable.
I am so glad we decided to try Baja Joe's. The food was very good, our waitress was super nice and attentive, and the prices were pretty good. Try it, you will be glad you did!
We had an amazing meal a week ago at Baja Joe's. we returned this week for tacos and everything was just as good. Service great and food amazing.

Yes, this is as good as it gets.
I take the family on Sundays after church and the food has always been outstanding.  We lapsed for awhile but revisited on 10/17/2010 to find new signage (and later we find new ownership).  But the new owners very very wisely kept the menu!
The Toritos de Camaron are reason enough to go.  But everything else we've ever had is really really good too.  I go to Mazatlan 1-2 times a year and it's just like going back.  
This is not chain-Mexican or Tex-Mex...it's the real thing.  Do yourself a favor and try it out!

I didn't order any seafood here (which is easily the majority of the menu) so admittedly my view on this place may be somewhat less than informed.

That being said what I did have (red beef burrito, rice beans) was meh.  Not especially bad, not especially good.

I did really like the salsa.

Love the food.  Yes it's in a bar but their food is actually really good. This is not a Mexican restaurant where I order a meat taco and enchiladas.  This is a place where you get their specialties such as the carne asad plate (special marinade and grilled) of you order their seafood dishes. Excellent seafood soups too such as soup of the 7 seas...  Drinks are good but service is slow. It's still worth the wait if you aren't in the fast food style mood. The table side guacamole is a must...

Service was outstanding tonight.  We actually had two gals serving us.  They were helpful with the menu because this was our first (but not last) visit.  Attentive to every need.  Never an empty glass  or dirty dish left on the table.  Shared a chicken and steak fajita with my husband.  OMG, seriously the best fajita I have had in years.  Didn't care for the red onions, I like sweet onions, but other than that, loved every bite.  Did I mention the rice?   Usually the Mexican rice is pretty tasteless, it was moist and very flavorful.  Will definitely be back!!!!
